Used as fortifier for adjectives, most proper translation into English being often "very" or "quite".; Used with numerals to indicate that the figure is either in high or low end of the ordinary range. Translated into English as "as much as, up to, even" or "as little as".

cooperation based on common agreement, union

oevre; opus; work (literary, artistic or intellectual)
A summit, topmost point of eg. a hill or trajectory.
speed, velocity, pace, momentum; (physics) speed; (slang) methamphetamine
A Member of The Finnish Parliament; congressperson
A round, as a circular or repetitive route; a round, as a serving
A post, position, office, public office
A document covering the description and results of an investigation, a report.
being, the action of the verb olla
A thin, flat object of uniform thickness; a plate.
descent, an instance of descending, sliding down a hill, landing of an airplane etc.
The border of a body of water and land in general, a shore.
An opponent in a game, fight, competition, politics etc.
whole, entirety, totality; big picture, gestalt.
province; administrative region in size between municipal and national
In Finnish school system, a 3-year school that prepares the students for academic studies corresponds to high school in many other places.
A person living in or originating from the area of the historical province of Häme, sometimes called Tavastian or Tavastlander in English texts.
fire; an event of something burning; ardor
sprout; bud; young tree; scion; (informal) child, kid
large building used for sports or exhibitions, eg. indoor arena, gallery
An afternoon, roughly the period between 12 noon and 6 p.m.
An exchange especially a stock exchange.

In municipal government, a committee appointed by the municipal council, which has the authority to make decisions within an agenda specified by the law and the municipal council concerned; sometimes also translated into English as board.
Population; the people living within a political or geographical boundary.
labor force, labour force, labour, manpower, workforce
The truth, reality, the real thing.
A regional office of the Finnish Ministry of Environment, officially translated into English as Centre for Environment.
A minister or secretary of finance, or in some countries, treasurer.
two (digit, symbol); deuce; second base; second gear
The early part of a year.
The act of flying or being in the air.
A violent death, mainly used of humans; Personification of sudden death; Killing, voluntary manslaughter under mitigating circumstances.
A photograph taken for and published in a newspaper.
Frost, as sub-zero temperature of ambient air.
A learning institution; anything from elementary school to university.
The upper level of the comprehensive school, consists of the three grades; corresponds lower high school.
A leading executive position in a non-profit organization. English terms for corresponding position include CEO, secretary-general.
A magical artifact in the Kalevala; it provided wealth to its owner.
A large belly; a beer belly.
The act of dividing, sharing or dealing
One of next few years; normally used in plural.
A holiday home, self-catering cottage, also known as a kesämökki; a summer cottage.
A chairman or speaker; a title used of the chair of certain bodies instead of the more common puheenjohtaja. eduskunnan puhemies = the speaker of the parliament puhemies Mao = chairman Mao
Elementary school, primary school; the first six grades of the comprehensive school.
motorist, someone who drives a car
A ride Voitko antaa minulle kyydin? Can you give me a ride?
ministry for foreign affairs, foreign ministry, Foreign Office State Department
An independent state. Depending on context, may be translated into English as country, state, kingdom, empire, nation, realm etc.
Rock, as the aggregate of solid mineral matterthat constitutes a significant part of the earth's crust.
Answerer, person who answers or responds.
facial expression, look, mien, appearance, countenance
A public communicator, communicator, mouthpiece; spokesman, spokesperson.
first half or a more vaguely defined first part of anything, like of a period of time, semester, holiday, trip etc.
A fermented beverage made of malt: beer, ale.
east, one of the cardinal points of the compass
The act of being produced, fabrication, making, production.
a slender, hanging branch, as of a birch or a willow.
bureau, office, agency, board regional or locallevel)
A mobile phone, mobile telephone, cellular or cell phone.

Formally, a degree earned in a Finnish university roughly corresponding to the master's degree. It generally requires about five years' full-time studies, including a thesis. It is normally accompanied with a specification of the branch of art or science.
A gift or souvenir given by visitors or someone returning from a travel.
One hundredth of a markka, the Finnish currency until the introduction of euro in 2002.
ministry of finance; Department of the Treasury Her Majesty's Treasury, Treasury
anniversary; used only with a numeral indicating the number of years being celebrated.
exit, intersection, junction on a highway
A photograph taken for and published in a newspaper.
In the Finnish school system the 9-year comprehensive school starting at age of 7 years.
spruce, any tree in the genus Picea.
Rural municipality, a former type of municipalities in Finland.
A public organization owned by a group of municipalities. They are common for such tasks as managing a hospital, which would be too burdensome for only one municipality.

A plan of action of a national government for its planned term, officially translated as "Government Programme" into English. The programme is agreed upon before the term begins in negotiations between the political parties which agree to form the government.
modern era, modern period, modern times
A national trade union typically representing employees within a branch of industry. Typically so called blue collar and white collar employees are organized in separate unions.
a group or forest of aspen trees, alternative form of haavikko.
An assist, as a statistical recognition of making a pass that leads directly towards scoring.
A generally flat cover of a hole or a container such as a jar or a box; a lid or a top
A twosome, group of two, duet, duo, pair.
the last or remaining months of a year.
core, the central part of something
military force applied from the air
A notch, a dent or a nick.
cooperation based on common agreement, union

A subsidy similar to equalization payment, but made by the national government to municipalities in order to compensate for the differences between the municipalities in demographic and economic conditions.
a Social Democrat; alternative spelling of sosiaalidemokraatti.
The process of investigating, an investigation.
A person who is qualified or professionally engaged in any branch of engineering, an engineer.
A still life, as a motif of a painting.
season regular season home and away season
talk, conversation; used especially in compound terms
A period of about one year; used often in plural to signify years, several years or "years and years".
A military alliance such as the NATO or the Warsaw Pact.
Action noun of the verb toteuttaa.
ministry of transportation or similar ministry with another name responsible for the administration of the transportation system in a country
The Winter War, fought between Finland and Soviet Union in 1939-40.
A side, as that of a human or an animal.
ministry of the interior, ministry of internal affairs
A threesome, group of three, trio.

The highest official of lääni which is a Finnish administrative unit between the state and municipalities. Maaherra is appointed by the central government, and is usually translated as governor into English.
A poor used especially in plural: "the poor" = köyhät.
An emission of a harmful substance such as exhaust gas.
A pay raise pay rise a raiseor rise
a single hair, strand of hair
Until 1999 a province-level administrative court which handled taxation-related and other administrative cases.

income policy agreement; a bipartiteor tripartitenational agreement on salaries and other general terms and conditions of employment, sometimes supported by the government with tax incentives or legislative measures.
An educational qualification awarded to a person that has successfully completed the upper secondary school final exam.
white cedar, red cedar, any one of the species in the genus Thuja
The former Ministry of Labour of Finland, now part of the työ- ja elinkeinoministeriö.
The village in a rural municipality in which the main church and the vicariate were located.

A local branch of the Finnish työ- ja elinkeinoministeriöthat acts as employment agency, administrates public unemployment benefits and organizes vocational training, activation programs and counceling for the unemployed. Despite the wider scope of services they might still be called "employment agency" in English. The Ministry seems to prefer the term "TE Office" in their communication.
A wagon, coach, stagecoach; often used in pluralalso of a single vehicle
last half or a more vaguely defined last part of anything, like of a period of time, semester, holiday, trip etc.
A year of the past; normally used in plural to denote past .
A crash, collision, especially an automobile accident.
nursing home, rest home, old people's home, old-age home, rest-home, old folks' home
centre of gravity, center of gravity, centre of mass
A middle ranking Finnish church official of higher rank than a pappibut below the rank of piisp A dean, a parson, rector
A piece of evidence; in pluralevidence
A match, game or contest between two national teams of any sport.
A bout, fit; an attack of disease; a seizure.
A political party that has one or more ministers in a given government, governing party, ruling party
A value added tax. In some countriesthis kind of tax is called goods and services tax.
Action noun of the verb osoittaa.
An outstanding individual;a pick, choice, elite.
A tax based on the value of real estate. An exact English equivalent would be real estate tax but in practice property tax and millage tax are often based solely on the value of real estate.
Act of treading, stomping; used only in compounds.
prominent figure, influential person, opinion leader, power player, mover and shaker, dignitary, muckamuck, notable, panjandrum, very important person, VIP
Member of the European Parliament, MEP
A turn or twist, especially figuratively.
ministry of defense, department of defense
An area within a town or city.
The border of a body of water and land in general, a shore.
A "technical" term for food and fodder; nutrition, nourishment, nutriment.
esker; in colloquial language also a terminal moraine.
match currently mostly used in a number of idiomatic expressions.
public roads authority, public roads administration
Rock, as the aggregate of solid mineral matterthat constitutes a significant part of the earth's crust.
A light breeze or the small, disappearing waves on top of water produced by a breeze.
The beginning of a week, usually understood to include Monday and Tuesday.
A semi-domesticated reindeer of the subspecies Rangifer tarandus tarandus
A pier, wharf, quay, dock, mole.
An act in the passion play.
A top-level sports event such as the Olympic Games, World Championship games or national championships in some sports; no single clearly established English equivalent.
hooded crow, grey crow, Corvus cornix
A mother tongue, or the native language. Hän puhuu äidinkielenään englantia. He is a native speaker of English.
A person from, or an inhabitant of, Oulu
east, one of the cardinal points of the compass
A block or city block Kävelen vain korttelin ympäri. I'm just going for a walk around the block.
A gift or souvenir given by visitors or someone returning from a travel.
The Karelian language; a Finno-Ugric language spoken by about 100,000 people in Karelia. It is closely related to Finnish.

A federation; commonwealth, union Australian liittovaltio = Commonwealth of Australia Bahaman liittovaltio = Commonwealth of the Bahamas Dominican liittovaltio = Commonwealth of Dominica Mikronesian liittovaltio = Federated States of Micronesia Pohjois-Mariaanien liittovaltio = Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands liittovaltion tila -puhe = State of the Union address
the Ministry of Justice;the Department of Justice.
service station, gas station, petrol station, filling station
In sauna bathing, a cooling period between sessions in the hot room.
The bow of a boat or a ship.
a measure of distance between two outstretched arms, similar to one fathom
rented flat, rented apartment, rental apartment, lodgings
state of being subordinate; no direct English equivalent
A cowshed, designed and built for keeping animals, especially cows.
report, especially an official one given by the government to the parliament
A duck, a bird of the Anatidae family.

A national authority for collecting and compiling statistics on various fields of society and economy. The English terminology varies by country: see United States Census Bureau, Statistics Canada, Australian Bureau of Statistics, Office for National Statistics The Finnish Tilastokeskus is officially Statistics Finland in English.
A piece of furniture Sinulla on kivat huonekalut. You have nice furniture. Huoneessa oli vain muutamia huonekaluja. There were only a few pieces of furniture in the room.
occupant often used as head of compound term: toimenhaltija, viranhaltija
An order, command, commandment, dictation, behest.
A centre of a town or a city.
Those government services which are considered to serve the basic human needs, usually understood to include health and social services.
any member of the genus Allium
A city plan or town plan, which shows in detail each lot, positioning of buildings on the lot, traffic areas etc.
A politically correct term for an old person.
The lowest officer rank in Finnish police, above ylikonstaapeli and below ylikomisario, roughly equal to lieutenant in the U.S. and inspector in the UK.
A facility run by the Ministry of Interiorthat accommodates arriving refugees and asylum seekers, officially translated into English as reception centre.
A large pine tree with a straight trunk.

A former regional organizational unit of Finland's Ministry of Transport and Communications, which was responsible for maintenance and construction of roads in its designated area. The term is no longer in official use as their tasks have been transferred to the ELY-keskus.

A national authority for collecting and compiling statistics on various fields of society and economy. The English terminology varies by country: see United States Census Bureau, Statistics Canada, Australian Bureau of Statistics, Office for National Statistics The Finnish Tilastokeskus is officially Statistics Finland in English.
The final price at which a deal is concluded; used normally of items such as property for which the price is negotiated individually.
main thing, main issue, central point
A learning institution resembling a community college, providing adult education in a wide variety of topics. The programs are open for everyone, usually for a small fee.
a dead person, a departed,mies~ = the late husband;a deceased, decedent.
A tool used to handle the ball in various ball games. The translation into English depends on the kind of tool used in the particular game. Examples:
minister of education, secretary of education
Of a collective bargaining agreement, the quality of being universally binding, i.e. binding all employers in a given branch of economic activity.
An act of going over a limit, an instance of surpassing.
A person from, or an inhabitant of, Turku

A council formed by ministers, especially: The Council of the European Union, also referred to as "Council of Ministers" or simply "Council" The "Nordic Council of Ministers", an intergovernmental organ working within the framework of the Nordic Council.
A fire, an event of something burning Often compounded with a modifier indicating what's burning. Jotkut kemikaalipalot ovat hankalia sammuttaa. Some chemical fires are difficult to put out.
residence, place of residence, habitation, homestead

A variety of baseball developed in Finland in 1920's. There's no "official" translation into English, but "Finnish baseball" might be used, or simply "baseball" in contexts where the differences between the two games are not essential.
Any of the next few days.
pine, especially the Scots pine, Pinus sylvestris.
The act of giving birth; childbirth, parturition.
hay tehdä heinää = to hay, to make hay, to do hay
opposition, in compond terms often anti-
Farmland that is produced using the slash and burn technique.
small sled or sledge equipped with runners
An act of snatching, yanking or jerking
A lecture, especially one given in a higher learning institution as part of the curriculum.
health services; usually as a branch of municipal government

A regional or municipal board for promotion of business in its area of operation. There seems to be no uniform translation into English, but many of these boards call themselves "Business + name of city or region", e.g. "Business Seinäjoki" in their English communication.
A fist, hollow of the hand.
A music school providing musical training which starts from elementary level and prepares for professional studies.
homecourt, home court, home field, home stadium, home arena, home ice
The inside of something. In contemporary language sisä- serves as a prefix and the locative casesare used as adverbs and postpositions.
per mille, permille, per mil, per mill
A head shop steward; in a large workplace there may be several shop stewards, in which case one of them is appointed to represent them as a group towards the employer.
listed company, public company, publicly traded company, quoted company
sheltered home, sheltered accommodation, assisted living building
A container, a vessel or a receptacle
A magical artifact in the Kalevala; it provided wealth to its owner.
A small piece of almost anything.
An experienced person; veteran, old hand.
The aft part of anything, the rear, the back, the tail end
social security; usually as a branch of municipal government
anniversary; used only together with a cardinal number.
Another term for tulopoliittinen sopimus see usage notes under tulopolitiikka
parliamentary group in a council, especially a kunnanvaltuusto
A goal made by the winning team which adds the number of their goals to the final score of the losing team plus one.
A diary, especially one kept by an individual.
public roads authority, public roads administration
cattle sometimes with a specifier: nautakarja, lehmikarja
The illustration of a publication collectively.
first place, number one, first position in a race, election etc.

In Finnish ministries, the highest official below a minister, appointed for the term of the minister, also called määräaikainen valtiosihteeri or ministerin valtiosihteeri to separate from the permanent secretaries of state.

A preliminary investigation or hearing carried out by the police prior to starting the actual criminal procedure in order to find out whether a crime has been committed, what are the circumstances and who are the persons concerned.
A European crayfish, noble crayfish, broad-fingered crayfish, Astacus astacus.
fortune, luck Minulla kävi hyvä tuuri. I had good luck.
a narrow tailKoiralla on häntä, mutta linnulla ei. Dogs have a [narrow] tail, but birds do not.

The academic degree granted to a person who has completed engineering studies at master's level in a Finnish university, or such person himself. Usually translated into English as Master of Science in engineering, and abbreviated as M.Sc. or Master of Scienceabbreviated as M.Sc The Finnish abbreviation is DI. The word is used also to refer to corresponding foreign degrees and persons holding them.
A person from East Germany, Ossi.
improvement, healing, mending, recovery, recuperation, betterment
A supporter of a reformist movement within the Suomalainen puolue - the Finnish Party in late 19th century and later a supporter of the Nuorsuomalainen puolue - the Young Finnish Party.
insect of the order Lepidoptera; butterfly, moth or skipper.
A formal title granted to a lawyer who has been trained on the bench and thus gained sufficient experience to act as a judge in a court.
An honorary title granted for lifetime by the President of the Republic of Finland for persons with remarkable merits in industry; no meaningful English translation.
opening period, opening half, opening round
internationalization; the act of becoming international
A population, as the count of the number of residents in a given area.
A mouse, used rather indiscriminately for a number of small mouse-resembling rodents mostly in the zoologic family Muridae, but also in Zapodidae and Gliridae.
An aunt , as mother's or father's sister.
Yankee, usually refers to all inhabitants of the United States

A boreal forest type appearing on moist moraine soils, characterized by dense growth of spruce as the dominating tree species and deep layer of moss as undergrowth. Korpi is often a transition zone between a drier kangas -type forest and various types of suo
fortune, luck Minulla kävi hyvä tuuri. I had good luck.
A guy, a dude or a bloke
member of a city council, councilman, councilor, alderman
second place, second position in a race, election etc.
flight mostly used in inessive and illative singular like an adverb, for usage see karussa, karkuun.
esker; in colloquial language also a terminal moraine.
Any of the next or past few weeks; mostly used in plural.
The share capital of a company
A rescue used also as modifier in compound terms. pelastusajoneuvo = a rescue vehicle
period of chairmanship, term of chairmanship
Originally any bag, but now mostly refers to a backpack.
The end of a week, usually understood to refer to a working week, i.e. to mean Thursday and Friday.
true Finn; member of the Finnish political party Perussuomalaiset, known in English as "True Finns".
A footballer, soccer player, football player.
A male goat, billygoat; a buck.
minister of health, secretary of health

Since 2012, Suomen Metsäkeskus, the state authority responsible for promoting forestry and good care of nation's forest resources. The authority uses "The Finnish Forest Centre" as its official English name. The centre belongs to the maa- ja metsätalousministeriö
right to vote, franchise, suffrage, voting right Fifteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution:

A municipal or regional authority responsible for providing public transportation in its area of operation. There's an ample supply of English equivalents, such as transit authority transit commission public transport authority
due process, protection under the law
Short for Kansainvälinen valuuttarahasto - the International Monetary Fund
In many ballgames, the forward that plays in the centre of the line; a centre.
A national footballassociation, especially the Football Association of Finland.
accounting period usually synonymous to fiscal year
schlager, hit song, adult pop song
environmental protection, conservation of the environment
A detective rank in Finnish police, equal in seniority to komisario.
Any of the plants of the genera Anemone and Hepatica.
accident site, site of the accident
A workshop to finalize a budget; used especially of an annual few days' workshop in which the state budget is balanced.
A short form of työkalupakki, which is a box designed to serve as a portable tool storage, a tool box.
Formerly in the Finnish school system, a four- to eight-year elementary school or primary school.
The gaseous element oxygen, symbol O.
A ranking list of World's best athletes in a given event.
work performed in the form of talkoot
average level, middle range; may often be translated into English with an adjective e.g. average, ordinary, middle-range
A routine inspection or checkup, especially anobligatory inspection of a car.
Late winter or early spring; the time between actual winter and spring.
early voting pre-poll voting advance polling special voting
The executive director of a maakunnan liitto
blind alley, dead-end, dead end, cul-de-sac

A committee named from the ministers of a government for discussion and limited decision-making on a specified field, such as economic or security policy. Such committees within the government of Finland are called "Cabinet Committee" in English.
shutdown, especially a step-wise process of stopping a system such as an industrial process or a business in a controlled manner
A fight, as a heated verbal or physical dispute between two or more parties; an altercation; a wrangle.
public health nurse, community health nurse
special waste; dangerous waste that can not be dumped in a normal dump
fresh sprig or small branch of a coniferous tree
A structure, any sort of physical construction.
A transaction, usually an acquisition or a merger, in which a business changes ownership.
seizing, occupation, act of occupying sth, act of taking over sth
campsite, camp site, camping site, camping area, campground, camping park
A female member of the Martha organisation.
gun with a calibre of more than 20 millimeters
A small piece of paper, textile etc.
The Finnish title and/or job title used of graduates in economics or business administration
dinner; in formal occasions often used in plural
building manager, administrator of a condominium, deputy landlord
Any person that paints, a painter.
A reindeer or a caribou, a general term used to refer to the deer species Rangifer tarandus and its twelve sub-species.
action noun of the verb tavoitella
European whitefish, common whitefish or any of its subspecies.
The act of driving around something, often in the form of a race.
A revelation, a disclosure, an exposure
A person from, or an inhabitant of, Tampere
The trees of an area collectively; the forest cover.
A learning institution resembling a community college, providing adult education in a wide variety of topics. The programs are open for everyone, usually for a small fee.

In Finland, a flat rate pension[1], to which people who are covered by the Finnish social security system are entitled, usually translated as "national pension" into English. The pension can be paid on the basis of old age, disability or long-term unemployment. Other income, such as earnings-related työeläkediminishes the national pension.
A Baltic herring, Clupea harengus membras.
An oral presentation or a lecture, especially one given at a learning institution to demonstrate the level of knowledge of the speaker.
competitive sports at the highest level
A person from, or an inhabitant of, Joensuu
state of the art, highest quality; often translated into English with expressions involving adjectives first-class, top-quality, top-notch
small hut or cell, compare koirankoppi
A slab, as a flat, broad piece of a relatively stiff material.
economic or financial difficulty / problem / trouble
Any comprehensive solution, which takes into account a large number of often contradictory interests.
A reign, the period of rule.
first half of anything, like of a period of time, semester, holiday, trip etc.
Minister of Forestry, a former minister position in the Finnish government.
A crash, collision, especially an automobile accident.
A day of being retired; mostly used in pluralto denote retirement.
The sport and practice of playing pesäpallo.
Minor damage; chip, knock, dimple, ding, dent.
A person from, or an inhabitant of, Lahti
The width or breadth of an object.
A workers' association founded by and working for the benefit of workers in its area of operation.
An uncapitalized form sometimes used of Kansaneläkelaitos, a government branch that administers and provides social security benefits for all residents of Finland.
upper house, upper chamber; House of Lords
household appliance, home appliance, domestic appliance
a former name of the Finnish political party Suomen Keskusta, in English officially called the Centre Party
an application, a plea, a requisition
scrap, junk, especially one that consists of metal objects.
rival candidate e.g. in an election
A local chapter of a trade union; lodge
An ex-pat who is returning home to live in their birth country.
A financial tool set up to implement the Regional policy of the European Union with the aim of reducing regional disparities in terms of income, wealth and opportunities.

A kind of cooperative entrusted with powers to regulate fishing and sell fishing licenses in a stipulated hydrological area. The members are typically the owners of the fishing rights. No established English translation, fishery board might be close.
An underground, a subway, a Tube or a metro.

A backbone, spine or spinal column.
A bankruptcy estate or, more shortly, estate.
The tips of the thumb and another finger or fingers pressed together.
the maximum total constructed floor area allowed on a given lot; equal to the product of floor area ratio and the area of the lot.
The place from which rapids in a river start.
A reindeer or a caribou, a general term used to refer to the deer species Rangifer tarandus and its twelve sub-species.
A female member of the Martha organisation.

selective breeding, cross-breeding and other techniques for developing improvedvarieties or cultivars of plants and animals
An apartment in an apartment building.

Of a form, -formed, -shaped. Used always with a modifier which, if it is a noun or pronoun, is in genitive and determines the kind of form. The modifier and muotoinen are written as one or two words without a clear rule when to use which way of spelling. If the modifier is an adjective, it is always in nominative and the resulting word is written as one word.
